RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the occupants: Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Campos, and others
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.its occupants: Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Campos, and others
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the occupants of the truck: Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Campos, and others
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the truck's occupants: Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Campos, and others
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the vehicle's occupants: Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Campos, and others

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: Defendant stopped by border patrol agents on an interstate highway in Texas, owner of the truck, appellant in the current case, with a vehicle that had an apparent heavy load, occupants exhibited suspicious behavior when approached, vehicle was traveling at forty to forty-five miles per hour, contesting the district court's refusal to allow post-verdict discovery through juror depositions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.GARWOOD: Circuit Judge presiding over the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, drove the patrol car, did not testify to having reason to believe the vehicle came from the border, participated in the observation of the vehicle and its occupants, had specialized experience and training, testified about the passengers' behavior, received training in Spanish, and spoke and understood it to a limited extent
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, native Spanish speaker, observed the truck and its passengers, testified without contradiction about recent apprehensions of illegal alien smugglers, noted occupants' attempts to hide from flashlight, shined a flashlight into the truck cab, testified that it was unusual for vehicles to be traveling late at night at such a slow speed on that portion of Interstate 35, participated in approximately 150 separate incidents in which arrests were made for transporting illegal aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron: Agents who conducted the stop of Garcia's truck, applied the multi-factorial test to determine reasonable suspicion, observed suspicious behavior from occupants, used flashlight to observe vehicle occupants at night, testified about occupants' attempts to hide from the flashlight, had specialized training as border patrol agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Lourdes Rangel-Campos: Driver of the camper, admitted to being a Mexican citizen without immigration documents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce: Namesake of a test regarding reason to believe a vehicle came from the border, used as a standard for suspicion in this case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Ca: Individuals present in the vehicle stopped by agents Pruszenski and Baron, exhibited suspicious behavior when approached by border patrol agents, appeared unwashed and unkempt, tried to hide from agent's flashlight, reacted to a bright light at night
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.TATE: Circuit Judge dissenting in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Allen: Reference to a properly given charge related to jury coercion, used in the context of the Allen charge being permissible within limitations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the appellant: Appellant in the current case, contesting the district court's refusal to allow post-verdict discovery through juror depositions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pena-Cantu: involved in a comparison of passenger conduct, where behavior was less suspicious than in the current case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Orona-Sanchez: involved in a previous ruling where passenger behavior was deemed insufficient to justify a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pacheco: involved in a case where passengers 'hunkered down' in the seat, considered suspicious but not sufficient for a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Lamas: involved in a comparison of passenger conduct, exhibiting more suspicious behavior than in Pena-Cantu and Orona-Sanchez
